result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence E Grabowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------
Reimburse "buy money" to the Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit in the amount of $365.00.
------------------------------
  **NOTE:  Defendant's attorney was court appointed and a wage assignment was put into effect and shall continue in effect until the Clerk of Courts Office is reimbursed in full for attorney's fees and costs.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow up with counseling recommendations.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before September 22, 2015 @ 8:00 am.
